messages.title: 5 MORE YEARS OF GORDON BROWN OR CHANGE WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: In just a few weeks we will have the most important election for a generation. Our economy is burdened by huge debts and millions are out of work. Our society is broken by crime and irresponsible behaviour. Our political system is in a mess. We can't go on like this. A Conservative government will take bold action on all fronts. We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving. We'll support families and back people who do the right thing to encourage responsibility in our society and we'll make sure pensioners are supported as well. And we need big changes in our political system too. We've led the way on cleaning up MPs' expenses and we'll finish the job by scrapping the perks and cutting the cost of Parliament. Most importantly, we'll take power away from the political elite to give you more control over your life. So that's the choice at this election: five more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or the change this country needs with the Conservatives.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour are now the party of unemployment. Conservatives will get Britain working again by boosting enterprise. We will abolish taxes on the first ten jobs created by new businesses, promote green jobs and help people off welfare and into work.

David Cameron has made the NHS our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone. The Conservatives will introduce new spending on the NHS every year. We are the only party to have made this commitment.

We will create a new generation of schools run by teachers and responsible to parents, not micromanaged by politicians. Parents will get what they want – small schools with smaller classes, good behaviour, great teachers and restored confidence in the curriculum.

Families are the foundation of a strong society. Our plans to improve Sure Start with 4,200 extra health visitors, extend flexible working, improve parental leave and open new schools will help make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.

issues.economy: We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving. Support families and back people who do the right thing to encourage responsibility in our society.
issues.education: We will create a new generation of schools run by teachers and responsible to parents, not micromanaged by politicians.
issues.governance: We've led the way on cleaning up MPs' expenses and we'll finish the job by scrapping the perks and cutting the cost of Parliament.
issues.health: David Cameron has made the NHS our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone.
issues.socialWelfare: Support families and back people who do the right thing to encourage responsibility in our society and we'll make sure pensioners are supported as well.

images.caption: David Cameron and members of the Conservative Party in various settings, interacting with the public and professionals.
